In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it in Julia using the DataFrames package.

First, make sure you have installed the necessary packages by running these lines of code in your terminal or command prompt:
```julia
using Pkg
Pkg.add("DataFrames")
Pkg.add("Dates")
```

Once you've done that, here is how to create a new column `ym` with the year and month from your DateTime `dt`:

```julia
using DataFrames
import Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x) for x in df[:dt]]
end
```
This function iterates over every DateTime `dt` in the DataFrame and calculates a new year-and-month integer. It then adds this value to the column `ym`. The year is multiplied by 100 so that we can easily concatenate it with the month without any leading zeroes.
